title: Invoice task items become disordered after X item
body:
**What version of Invoice Ninja are you running? ie v4.5.25 / v5.0.30**
5.1

**What environment are you running?**
Docker

**Have you checked log files (storage/logs/) Please provide redacted output**

**Have you searched existing issues?**
Yes

**Have you reported this to Slack/forum before posting?**
Pending post on discourse forum

**Describe the bug**
The order of the task items becomes out of order after the 17th+ item or when the item table reaches the 2nd page of the PDF invoice

**Steps To Reproduce**

- Create an invoice
- Assign Client
- Fill Tasks till you reach the 2nd page of the pdf invoice

**Expected behavior**
keep the same order as displayed from the invoice item

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9761338/116739648-e9ba1200-a9c1-11eb-99a5-b1a09e79df75.png)


**(v5) Can you replicate the issue on our demo site? https://demo.invoiceninja.com**
Yes, actually
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9761338/116739903-3b629c80-a9c2-11eb-8843-aa869f4a81c6.png)

title: Billable-flag for TWIG sometimes wrong after tracking time and turned task into invoice
body: ## Setup - Version: v5.12.15-L174 - Environment: Docker ## Interface Flutter ## Describe the bug I've tracked some service with the flutter-desktop-app on Linux (Flatpack). When I create an invoice out of the tracked task the time-log-billable-flag for TWIG is set to false while it's originally not touched at all. In the task-section so it's set to true (as it has to be). To solve this, I have to change the flag(s) manually to not billable, save the task, and then set it back to billable (and save it again), to set the twig-flag correctly. The hours, however, seem to be correct in the invoice. ### Steps To Reproduce Good question, I cannot reproduce the issue on will. ### Expected Behavior The flag should always fit to the set flag in the task. ### Screenshots This is the untouched result of creating an invoice out of 2 billable task-logs. This is after I set one of the billable-checkboxes to not billable and back. I left the other one on billable. (Sorry, I marked the wrong checkbox red.) ### Logs Seems there are no laravel-log-entries of creating this invoice-pdf.

title: Link to customer in "Data Visualizations" doesn't include invoiceninja base path.
body:
**Invoice Ninja - v4.5.18 | White labeled** self-hosted.

In Settings -> Advanced Settings -> Data Visualizations, hovering over a customer "circle" shows a popup with "total" , "balance" & "age" and a link to the customer's account.

The link should be: 
`https://example.com/invoiceninjapath/clients/12345`
however it's actually 
`https://example.com/clients/12345`
which is a broken link if IN isn't in the webroot.

Also, while I might just be misunderstanding something, it seems like Data Visualizations should be on the menu under "Reports", not in Advanced Settings, since it seems to be a report and not a setting.

title: Custom Client Portal CSS is overwritten
Link button does not work when you insert a varible into it.
body:
On the Invoice Template Page, the Link button does not accept varibles. On the GUI (Self Hosted for me) when modifying the Invoice Template if I wish to make a link that leads to a portal page I click the link button and when prompted for the link I put in the variable to the area I want to lead to. This creates an empty link. I have to edit the raw text and paste the variable in there. Example of desired raw text... `
You may pay this bill On-Line with a Credit Card` What I get when I use the link button in the WYSIWYG interface... `
You may pay this bill On-Line with a Credit Card`

title: Exchange rate of payments is rounded incorrectly leading to incorrect values!
body:
**Story:**
I have clients in Europe, but I receive payments in British Pounds. My bank only deals with British Pounds; any payments received are automatically converted by them.

When I create payments in Invoice Ninja, I use the currency converter to record that the payment was converted by my bank.

The amount paid is the same as on the invoice, which is the amount in EUR. The amount after conversion is the amount in my bank account.

**Problem:**
When I type in the amount, Invoice Ninja calculates the exchange rate for that amount. The exchange rate field only allows 4 decimal places. It can't calculate the correct value to reach the same number I just typed in.

The result is that I'll type in a number like "902.09" and Invoice Ninja will change it to "902.07" for me, which does not match the amount that I actually received.

**Proposed solution:**
Increase the exchange rate field to allow 5 decimal places. This will allow every possible value to be represented.

title: Setup terms and conditions and privacy policy links should open in new tab.
body: **What version of Invoice Ninja are you running? ie v4.5.25 / v5.0.30** v5.1.14-C44 **What environment are you running?** Docker **Have you checked log files (storage/logs/) Please provide redacted output** Yes **Have you searched existing issues?** Yes **Have you reported this to Slack/forum before posting?** No **Describe the bug** When I was in the setup steps I clicked the terms and conditions and well, it navigated away from the settings page and I lost the settings I had typed in. Minor inconvenience but quality of life kind of thing. **Steps To Reproduce** Set up new installation (e.g. Docker) then click the Terms and Conditions or Privacy Policy on setup page. **Expected behavior** Have this on the hyperlink ```target="_blank"``` **Additional context** Privacy policy has a copy pasta in its label as well. From memory it was something like this. ```html Terms Privacy Policy ```

title: "Buy now" button "Payment" landing page does not work with iframe client portal
body:
When using the iframe client portal solution on my own website, there is a problem when you use the **buy now button**.

The option “Landing Page” under “Buy Now Buttons” has two options:

- Invoice
- Payment

The **payment** option does not work, it will always show the **invoice page** first.

I can see the iframe code is not setup to show this properly:

```
<center>
<iframe id="invoiceIFrame" width="100%" height="1200" style="max-width:1000px"></iframe>
<center>
<script language="javascript">
var iframe = document.getElementById('invoiceIFrame');
iframe.src = 'https://app.invoiceninja.com/view/'
             + window.location.search.substring(1, 33);
</script>
```

It should be something like this:

```
<center>
<iframe id="invoiceIFrame" width="100%" height="1200" style="max-width:1000px"></iframe>
<center>
<script language="javascript">
var iframe = document.getElementById('invoiceIFrame');
var ninja_hash = window.location.search.substring(1, 33);
iframe.src = (window.location.search.substring(1).search('credit_card') != -1 ? 'https://app.invoiceninja.com/payment/' + ninja_hash + '/credit_card' : 'https://app.invoiceninja.com/view/' + ninja_hash);
</script>
```

Now the invoice options works, you are redirected to that page

title: Adding an account/ company should not go via login form
body:
This is a part of #382 - but here as separate bug, to have it separated better.
I said that I report every bug I find ;-)

when adding a company (self hosting), I do the following:
- click on the user menu, `manage companies`
- I get to  `/login?new_company=true`, which is the login form with a button "new account"
- now I enter the credentials (thinking that they should go here) and click on "new account".
- I get a javascript warning/wuestion wether I _really_ want to leave that site, which is disturbing.
- This whole page is wrong here. instead of linking to the login form, "add account" should **directly** go to the form where I can enter the credentials for a new company/account.

I know that has something to do with the hosted version and the nature how accounts are created there. But can't this be skipped a) on self-hosted installs, b) on your hosted install when some conditions are true (I don't know NI that good - pro users? logged in ones? only you as admins?)

title: Credit card - "Pay Now" becomes indefinitely disabled if incorrect CC information is entered in the first instance
body:
**What version of Invoice Ninja are you running? ie v4.5.25 / v5.0.30**
5.3.23

**Describe the bug**
If a user enters incorrect credit card information and clicks "Pay now" the user will be advised which field is invalid but the button to "Pay now" becomes disabled/greyed out so even after correcting the card details the form cannot be submitted. The only way to retry is to refresh the page.

### Demo: 
https://youtu.be/-Tw7Gs8vQDY

**Steps To Reproduce**
https://youtu.be/-Tw7Gs8vQDY

**Expected behavior**
The user should be advised of the incorrect fields, and once they are corrected, the Pay Now button should be re-enabled so the user can submit the form again.

**Screenshots**
https://youtu.be/-Tw7Gs8vQDY

title: Cannot select English or any except a limited set of currencies.
body:
Hi. Fresh install of v5.5.48-C102 and cannot select English for my user, nor can I select my chosen currency (ZAR.) I checked the database and under languages and currencies there are many more options available than what the interface allows me.

Ex:
From database:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64781143/207700960-1706cf6c-f625-4bcf-87d5-b7275bdb14de.png)

Total of 113 currencies in the table.
From the interface:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64781143/207701130-e711a20b-864a-4461-a51b-e02de53d6886.png)
As well as Vanuatu Vatu, the Zim Dollar and "texts.currency_swazi_lilangeni"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64781143/207701283-adb894bc-df68-47d7-be10-854396fd5dc1.png)

If I try and type in the currency it just reverts to blank.

Similar with language:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64781143/207701390-dd08e614-e4c7-4124-a282-08644e4a7e7d.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64781143/207701421-40e3015b-cea8-4936-a793-ecef985a744a.png)

English is not selectable.

Am I missing something obvious? I guess I could just set it by updating the table from mysql, but I would prefer using the interface.

TIA.

title: Payment Links / Subscriptions + BTCPay payment module = instant settled invoices without payment
body:
<!-- Before posting please check our "Troubleshooting" category in the docs: 
https://invoiceninja.github.io/en/self-host-troubleshooting/ -->

## Setup
- Version: v5.11.51
- Environment: Shared Hosting (Tar from GitHub)

## Interface
- [ ] Flutter:
- [X] React:
- [ ] Both:

## Checklist
- [ ] Can you replicate the issue on our v5 demo site https://demo.invoiceninja.com or https://react.invoicing.co/demo? (not tried out yet/no account)
- [X] Have you searched existing issues?
- [ ] Have you reported this to Slack/forum before posting?
- [X] Have you inspected the logs in storage/logs/laravel.log for any errors? -> nothing found

## Describe the bug
When a user orders a product (recurring monthly or single payment) through one of my payment links, I instantly get an email about a completed payment, when in fact the user didn't even see my BTCPay payment gateway.

### Steps To Reproduce
* setup BTCPay as only payment method
* create a payment link with one product (a) for 0,10 EUR
* let user use the payment link, they login and get this form:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/00bfaaba-2b1c-4929-bffe-51276ec167ac)

no payment method can be selected.

### Expected Behavior
Show the BTCPay payment method and send the user through the payment process for the first invoice for recurring invoices and keep the invoice as unpaid as long as that hadn't happend. Subsequent invoices should be handled the same way.

## Additional context
Currently running a testinstance, so anything can be tried out on request.

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

### Logs
<!-- Please check the log files (storage/logs/) and provide redacted output -->
```

```

title: Approve button remains greyed out if signature pop up is closed + delay on signature approval
body:
v5.4.4-C85

These issues have been causing confusion with my clients.

VIDEO HERE: https://youtu.be/XmRvw8ylbbo

If signatures are enabled, when a client goes to view their quote/invoice and clicks the approve button in the client portal, a box appears asking for the signature as expected.

![Screenshot 2022-06-30 134016](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52687659/176587843-48b5a344-4599-4428-9e32-085677773f6b.png)


However if the client clicks the "Close" button, the approve button is not made active again and remains greyed out and un-clickable unless the page is refreshed.

Additionally, if you have quotes set to be converted to invoices automatically on approval, if the client does sign and clicks "Next Step", there can be a significant delay before the page updates and shows the new invoice. It's possible to see that there is page activity happening from the browser tab showing the spinning wheel but most people don't notice this and wondering whats happening. There needs to be some sort of loading animation presented to the user on the page or the approve button so the client knows something is processing.

title: (v5) Force migration doesn't delete default company
body:
"Force migration" option from v4 to v5 doesn't delete default company
When deleting default company from v5 after migration, website stuck during deletion, press F5 force user to reconnect. But default company is correctly deleted.

title: Negative figures still displayed in correctly in unit cost
body:
<!-- Before posting please check our "Troubleshooting" category in the docs: 
https://invoiceninja.github.io/docs/self-host-troubleshooting/ -->

## Setup
- Version: v5.5.78-C108
- Environment: Docker

## Checklist
- Can you replicate the issue on our v5 demo site https://demo.invoiceninja.com or https://react.invoicing.co/demo? Yes
- Have you searched existing issues? Yes
- Have you reported this to Slack/forum before posting? Yes, [previously reported on the forum](https://forum.invoiceninja.com/t/cosmetic-defects-in-pdf-view-when-unit-cost-values-are-negative/12660/3)
- Have you inspected the logs in storage/logs/laravel.log for any errors? Yes, nothing useful found

## Describe the bug
The negative figures in unit cost column are still displayed incorrectly & inconsistently:
- If the value is a whole negative number, the .00 decimal part is stripped. If it's not a whole negative number, the display is correct.
- The minus sign is placed behind the dollar sign, which is inconsistent with the display elsewhere in the app

### Steps To Reproduce
1. Create a product with a negative unit cost value.
2. Create an invoice with that product and witness the result.

### Expected Behavior
The .00 part should not be obliterated. The minus sign should be placed before the dollar sign. Notice that the correct behaviour in the line total column.

## Additional context
A previous fix is already implemented in commit 681fc47a68d67c467d75a428d99fd9a5c5b3c9fb

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11343760/222041027-780d72de-f4ae-4312-b9be-d5c190b70dbc.png)

### Logs
N/A

title: Project Kanban: Added task is hidden
body: If we add a new task on a projects Kanban it disappears. We can only see it, if we clear the filter on the top right - which is set by default if we open the Kanban board of a given project.

title: invoice terms in mobile html version does not replace the placeholder
body:
## Setup
- Version: v5.11.33
- - Environment: Docker

## Interface
- Both: []

## Checklist
- Can you replicate the issue on our v5 demo site https://demo.invoiceninja.com or https://react.invoicing.co/demo?
- YES
- Have you searched existing issues?
- Should have been solved here: [https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/issues/9557](https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/issues/9557)

## Describe the bug
If placeholders, e.g. $due_date, are used in the invoice terms, these are not replaced in the mobile version of client portal.

### Steps To Reproduce
Create a invoice with placeholder in invoice terms ($due_date), mark as send and open it in mobile Version of client portal, click view PDF scroll down and click terms. Therefor in Settings -> Client-Portal -> Mobile Version has to be activated

### Expected Behavior
replacement of the placeholder

## Additional context

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/559e03a6-0e19-475b-9bb4-a6b431ae5646)

title: Unexpected line spacing on Purchase Orders
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/discussions/10378
Originally posted by **TechGrips** December 13, 2024 ### [[_Copied from the forum_](https://forum.invoiceninja.com/t/unexpected-line-spacing-on-purchase-orders/17515)] ## Version 5.10.54 ## Environment: Other - Rocky 9 VM, nginx, npm, MySQL ## Checklist - Can you replicate the issue on our v5 demo site https://demo.invoiceninja.com or https://react.invoicing.co/demo? - > Yes actually! This issue replicates on both demo environments. - Have you searched existing issues? - > Yes, could not find any others mentioning this. - Have you inspected the logs in storage/logs/laravel.log for any errors? - > Yes, no errors are present there. ## Describe the bug Using the Business design for all document types, there is bizarre line spacing for my company contact details, my company address, and the payee's details on a Purchase Order. Here is a screenshot of my Quote with great line spacing: ![PO_Spacing_Issue1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/08972eaf-88ba-4e41-92fc-cc780ad1ac76) Now here is the Invoice, again with great line spacing: ![PO_Spacing_Issue2](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a858f116-951b-4149-93a6-b1f9d47844b5) And finally, where I believe there to be an issue, here is the Purchase Order with ugly line spacing: ![PO_Spacing_Issue3](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b952d7d4-6b8d-4c0e-b1eb-bd5ed6db5dbf) - Notice 3 unexpected line spaces between company name and company website - There is also 2 unexpected line spaces between company address line-1 and company address city/state/zip. - The payee information is very far indented away to the right of `PO issued to:` text, instead of directly below as seen in the Quote and Invoice templates. This creates a large block of oddly useless space under here. - This all creates a bunch of awkward whitespace under the logo, under the address, etc. This image is 50px taller than the other two while capturing the same information due to this spacing issue. ### Steps To Reproduce It's important to note I have not modified this application or changed/added/removed any code of any kind from anywhere. I started using the application recently, I added my logo, all my company details, some clients and vendors, and removed a few built-in variable fields here and there. In the case of the PO, I only removed the 'Number' field from the default set in Settings > Invoice Design > Purchase Order fields. ### Expected Behavior I'd expect the header for the Purchase Order and the static information held there to certainly look identical to headers in the Quote & Invoice, without the unnecessary line spacing I show here. I think that should detail this enough. This is obviously some kinda bug, right? I believe from what I've seen around the InvoiceNinja ecosystem that Purchase Orders are one of newer big features. I really like the Business design and would prefer to keep it to retain a consistent brand across my customer & vendor-facing documents. Thanks, let me know!

title: Total taxes for each tax_rate are not displayed correctly when an item is tax exempt
body:
## Setup - Version: web: 8.3.10 cli: PHP 8.3.10 (cli) API: 5.10.19 - Environment: self-hosted ## Interface - React ## Describe the bug Some of our invoices have line items with negative or zero amount and some have a tax rate of 0%. This leads in some cases to the situation that the total taxes at the bottom of the invoice are not displayed correctly. We are using the Calculate Taxes option where we have a standard tax_rate of 20% and a reduced tax_rate of 10%. We also defined a custom tax_rate of 13% (where I have to choose “override tax” on the create invoice page to use it). ### Example to reproduce: Create new invoice with 4 line items: ``` Item | Tax rate | Cost ----------------------------------------- Item 1 | Override -> 13% | -1234.0 Item 2 | Tax Exempt | 0.0 Item 3 | Services | 0.0 Item 4 | Services | 123.0 ``` Then the totals at the bottom look like this: ``` Net -1.111,00 € USt 13% -160,42 € 20% 24,60 € Total -1.246,82 € ``` ==> The tax_name is not present for the 20% taxes (it should be "USt 20%"). ### Screenshot: ![example_invoice_no_tax_name](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/89168add-3b1e-462a-84a7-1d807447e8e6)
When I put the Item with "Tax Exempt" at the bottom of the line_items list, then the total tax at the bottom is displayed correctly ("Ust 20%"). When i move it up again the tax name disappears. Also by creating an invoice with only positive amounts I wasn't able to reproduce this behavior. (When I create a similar invoice like the one above over the API then sometimes the line with the 20% tax at the bottom is missing completely.) By querying the invoice over the API I can see that there is no tax_name present for all the line_items that come after the "tax exempt" one with 0.0 cost. Another thing I just found out: In the example above, when I change the two line items with cost 0.0 to something positive, then I have two tax lines at the bottom, one with "20%" and another with "USt 20%".

title: Adjusted gateway fee doesn't show on the pay now button + redundant $0.00 label
body:
If you have the option to adjust fee percent for a payment gateway, it will check the actual payment gateway fee and adjust accordingly which is great.

I did a test and added a larger than normal fee for square (10%) and turned on the adjust fee percent toggle.

When a client goes to check out via the client portal, under the pay now button it shows 10% + $0.00 but if you click that and proceed, the fee is correctly adjusted on the next page.

I think if you have the adjust fee percent option, it should be showing the adjusted fee amount on the pay now button as well. Not showing 10% + $0.00 then suddenly being adjusted to 2.2% (the correct fee) on the next page.

It also makes no sense to have "+ $0.00" since square doesn't charge a fixed fee and I only have a percentage entered for the gateway  and no fixed fees. If no fixed fee is entered then it should only display the percentage on the pay now button. It looks messy currently.

![Screenshot 2022-08-12 000645](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52687659/184154030-08e88f69-8a7d-42cc-9170-c210a7afa495.png)
![Screenshot 2022-08-12 000713](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52687659/184154039-194ef13c-064f-4925-b526-05676a42525d.png)

title: Customer Portal > Pay Now Button > Credit Card fee is incorrect
body:
When I add a fee for credit card processing, a line item is generated on the invoice in the correct amount; however the fee displayed on the pay now button is not correct, it seems to be using the percentage fee I setup on the invoice total which already includes the fee.  For example, I have a fee setup on credit card transactions of $0.30 + 2.9%.  On a $2000.00 invoice a surcharge line item is added in the amount of $58.30 (this is correct) with an invoice total of ($2000 * 1.029) + .30 = $2058.30.  The issue is that the Pay Now button shows "Credit Card - $59.99 Fee" which is not correct.   If you take ($2058.30 * .029) + .30 you get $59.9907 (or $59.99) which is what we are seeing in the Pay Now button.

![screen shot 2018-05-18 at 11 49 47 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2146963/40244726-a35b7a2e-5a91-11e8-8c0c-e7e8df3663e2.png)

![screen shot 2018-05-18 at 11 39 31 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2146963/40244731-a840d5d4-5a91-11e8-8d24-ed97854f0344.png)

title: Recurring expenses logged with Expense Exchange Rate 0 (zero)
body:
<!-- Before posting please check our "Troubleshooting" category in the docs: 
https://invoiceninja.github.io/docs/self-host-troubleshooting/ -->

## Setup
- Version:  latest
- Environment: Docker

## Interface
- React only checked

## Describe the bug
When running a profit and loss report the Total Expense dollar amount is not correct. I can add up the listed expenses and it comes up to the higher (correct) amount. I have correlated this to two recurring expenses I have setup. Each time an automated recuring expense triggers, the expense exchange rate is a 0 (zero) where all my other manually entered expenses appear as an exchange rate of 1. -This was discovered running an expense report. My currency is USD and I do not deal with any other currency or exchange rates. When I look at the automated expense entries in the app…the currency settings between the automated expenses and my manually entered expenses are identical. The difference in the Total Expense dollar amount in the profit and loss report, is the exact amount of these automated recuring expenses that show a 0 (zero) for the Expense Exchange Rate. 

### Steps To Reproduce
Create recuring expense. I had just two and they have been in place since April 2024. All entries created by this automated process where affected.

### Expected Behavior
Use the default exchange rate settings defined. I do not use any exchange rates or conversions and when manually entering expenses I do not make any related changes. I would expect recurring expenses to follow the same rules. 

## Additional context
The "quick" fix was opening each of these automated expense entries in the app (react ui), making no changes, and just clicking save. This resulted in each affected entries Expense Exchange Rate to change to a 1. This was verified by running another expense report as well as another profit and loss report which now shows the correct Total Expense dollar amount. I have deleted recuring expenses for now.

### Screenshots
Screen snip from expense report showing one manual entry with a "1" and one automated recurring expense entry which is created with a "0". 
![image](https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/assets/866696/ee5895ac-c4c7-4e39-a7c1-15d82994d4e7)

The field displays fine in the custom editor preview window.

title: Frequency's for recurring invoices are double and behave incorrect
body:
Case:
I upgraded to 3.2.1 this morning. 
After which the php artisan migrate command ran (automatically by going to the dashboard). 
Some time later the regular (cronjobbed) php artisan ninja:send-invoices ran

Problem:
I noticed at this point (because I get emails from it) that 2 invoices that were not due for 6 more months had been sent already. 
I double checked, but both had this setup:
- Invoice sent at (some date a few months in the past, sorry I can't remember exactly which one)
- Frequeny: a year
- Invoice last sent at: today

Digging deeper I found that:
- The selectable frequency's are displayed double (see below screenshot)
- The selectable frequency's are double in the database
- Also, what I found is that selecting the first "annual" (jaarlijks in dutch) seems to yield a semi-annual frequency. This would explain why the 2 invoices were already sent.

I hope this explanation is clear enough. My first instinct was to delete the wrong invoices and send apologizing messages to my customers so I cannot accurately recall all steps I have taken. I believe the above is the gist of it.

![screenshot from 2017-04-27 10-58-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17289887/25476356/37ca893a-2b3a-11e7-8440-eca1429d5658.png)
![screenshot from 2017-04-27 10-58-46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17289887/25476358/37cc202e-2b3a-11e7-80a5-b30eaf3848a3.png)

title: Expense-reports: Amounts are swapped if switch
body:
<!-- Before posting please check our "Troubleshooting" category in the docs: 
https://invoiceninja.github.io/docs/self-host-troubleshooting/ -->

## Setup
- Version: v5.10.4-L160
- Environment: Docker

## Interface
- Flutter: [] (when I click "Reports" it doesn't show the reports-page anymore :-/ )
- React: [X]
- Both: []

## Checklist
- Can you replicate the issue on our v5 demo site https://demo.invoiceninja.com or https://react.invoicing.co/demo?
Couldn't replicate it, because it didn't show me tax rates when I create a new expense
- Have you searched existing issues?
Yes
- Have you reported this to Slack/forum before posting?
No
- Have you inspected the logs in storage/logs/laravel.log for any errors?
No

## Describe the bug
In expense-reports one can set the columns 'amount' and 'net amount'. Creating an expense one can set the switch 'amount incl. taxes'. If this switch is set to on, in the report the Amount will be shown including taxes and the 'net amount'-amount without taxes. BUT if the switch is set to off, the amount-columns are swapped. So within the same (!) exported report the amount of the expense is set to excluding taxes and the 'net amount' which always should be without taxes ("Netto-Betrag" in German, which means the amount without taxes or other includes) shows the amount including the tax(es). So depending on how the 'tax including'-switch is set the columns show the right or wrong amount in an report-CSV-file.

However the Flutter-desktop-app sorts the amounts correctly on the expense-overview.

### Screenshots
![Bildschirmfoto vom 2024-07-01 11-17-42](https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/assets/140073251/1edf80a1-4c24-4ca1-9ff1-b006681139cd)

title: Account Confirmation Link is written in white on white
body:
**What version of Invoice Ninja are you running? ie v4.5.25 / v5.0.30**
v5.1.5-C41

**What environment are you running?**
Docker

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65533611/107924671-a7ad3280-6f73-11eb-91b0-f0d62d96a386.png)

title: Bug: NINJA.parseFloat doesn't handle scientific notation floats
body:
I have an invoice that was fully paid (so balance is zero) but on editing, balance shows as -5.68. The problem is that when calculating the total, it isn't precise (as usually happens with floats) so when subtracting the paidToDate value, it ends up as a very small value, which JavaScript converts to a string with scientific notation.

parseFloat doesn't account for it by removing anything after the _e_: https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/blob/3a45a48a1adfca098e15ce2068b853bea4a0884c/resources/views/master.blade.php#L78

So -5.6844564245e-14 becomes -5.6844564245.

Adding any value ends up fixing the math:
![bug_InvoiceNinja](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1778527/58748799-7cb83d80-8475-11e9-89e5-2caea04590c7.gif)

Changing https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/blob/3a45a48a1adfca098e15ce2068b853bea4a0884c/resources/views/invoices/knockout.blade.php#L585-L587

to

```
    self.totals.total = ko.computed(function() {
        return self.formatMoney(accounting.toFixed(self.totals.rawTotal(), 2));
    });
```

fixes the visual issue, but not the underlying problem.

This seems similar to the old issue #104.

Suggestion for v2: use a library (at least in JS) for managing numbers, using floats directly is a pain for accounting applications.

title: Updater causes app to hang
body:
**What version of Invoice Ninja are you running?**
v5.1.58-C47

**What environment are you running?**
ZIP

**Describe the bug**
When clicking the update button, the whole page hangs and doesn’t respond to any user inputs.

**Steps To Reproduce**
1. Open updater
2. Click `Update now`

**Expected behavior**
Updater works without any troubles.

**Screenshots**

![Screenshot from 2021-05-03 15-24-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53079668/116881621-c393ac80-ac23-11eb-8973-0f1e5a1f7845.png)

```
NoSuchMethodError: b is undefined js_primitives.dart:47
<empty string> js_primitives.dart:47
Another exception was thrown: Instance of 'minified:lW<void>' 36 js_primitives.dart:47
```
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**(v5) Can you replicate the issue on our demo site? https://demo.invoiceninja.com**
No, because it lacks the updater…

title: Purge data right side bar
body:
Hello,
I go in Settings > Account Management > Purge Data
But after purging data the right bar still showing history, I try to clear cache with
> php artisan cache:clear

But nothing change

title: (v5) Logo is not migrated from v4
body: Logo is not migrated from v4. Back office show that a file is here, but it's empty / broken

title: Since last update text.small_company_info on invoice
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/invoiceninja/invoiceninja/discussions/10555
Originally posted by **andihuber** January 20, 2025 Hello, i updated last week to latest version from 5.10.x and i now have the following placeholder on my invoices: text.small_company_info It is applied after $tax_info in my invoice template. When i remove $tax_info then this placeholder is also not shown. But i need $tax_info. When i search on [github](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Ainvoiceninja%2Finvoiceninja+small_company_info&type=code) then it seems to have to do with the definition of “small company” where no taxes are applied. But i never changed my company info to that. Can someone tell me where i can define that i am no small company? Because i can not find it. Thank you, best regards, Andreas

title: Wrong time on date signature
body:
Hi,

I activated signature for quotes.
It works fine : signature is added on online PDF, with date/time printed below.

**But the time is wrong**.
Example : a quote signed today at 1.04 PM, the prince full date is 29-04-2018 7:04:07 am

However in Settings > Localizations, everything is fine.
Timezone = (GMT +01:00) Paris
Date/Time Format = 31-12-2018 12:00 am
24 Hour Time = enabled

And moreover, **the 24 hour time format is not applied on signature time**.
